column4: Is it possible for memtest86+ to not find any errors in memory, and yet the memory still be bad?
if they are in the first few KB that memtest86+ uses.. but it would probably segfault if it was
ahh.. i have a computer that won't even load the livecd (kernel oops).  It occasionally freezes during bios memory check as well
does it always segfault in the same place?
i mean oops.. does it always kernel oops in the same place?
have you tried memtest86 vs memtest86+?
yes, both complete a full pass with no errors
have you used any other OS on this machine? and does it work?
it used to have WinXP on it, which worked, but occasionally locked up (but that could just be windows)
is it overheating? what do the temp sensors say in the BIOS?
do you have any spare compatible RAM you can put in just to test?
I have another system I could temporarily take down and pull the RAM from... I'll try that now
or if it has two sticks of ram.. take the one from the second slot and put it in the first
that I've tried.. the system won't even POST with just stick2 in the first slot
same behavior as with both 1 and 2
it just freezes sometimes and kernel oopses? .. if you have a spare computer you could try putting stick1 in slot2 of that other computer.. and then running memtest
i'll try swapping the ram into this one first and see if it improves and then try that
